symptoms.description: Angina on exertion due to restricted blood flow.

symptoms.name: Syncope
symptoms.description: Fainting spells, especially during physical activity.

symptoms.name: Shortness of Breath
symptoms.description: Difficulty breathing during exertion.

aortic_stenosis.onset: Symptoms develop gradually over years as the valve narrows.
aortic_stenosis.notes: Often age related; may require surgical valve replacement.

symptoms.name: Heart Murmur
symptoms.description: A whooshing sound heard on cardiac examination.

symptoms.name: Exercise Intolerance
symptoms.description: Fatigue and shortness of breath during physical activity.

atrial_septal_defect.onset: Congenital defect; may be detected in childhood or adulthood.
atrial_septal_defect.notes: A hole in the atrial septum that may close spontaneously or require repair.

symptoms.name: Heart Murmur
symptoms.description: Characteristic murmur detected on auscultation.

symptoms.name: Poor Weight Gain
symptoms.description: In infants, failure to thrive may be noted.

ventricular_septal_defect.onset: Congenital; often identified in infancy or early childhood.
ventricular_septal_defect.notes: A defect in the ventricular septum; small defects may close on their own.

symptoms.name: Bounding Pulses
symptoms.description: Strong, forceful pulses felt in the extremities.

symptoms.name: Heart Murmur
symptoms.description: A continuous murmur due to abnormal blood flow.

symptoms.name: Respiratory Distress
symptoms.description: Difficulty breathing, especially in preterm infants.

patent_ductus_arteriosus.onset: Typically noted in the neonatal period.
patent_ductus_arteriosus.notes: A persistent opening between the aorta and pulmonary artery that may require closure.

symptoms.name: Hypotension
symptoms.description: Low blood pressure due to impaired heart filling.

symptoms.name: Muffled Heart Sounds
symptoms.description: Soft or distant heart sounds on examination.

symptoms.name: Jugular Venous Distension
symptoms.description: Elevated neck vein pressure.

pericardial_tamponade.onset: Can develop acutely over minutes to hours.
pericardial_tamponade.notes: A medical emergency caused by fluid accumulation in the pericardial space.

symptoms.name: Chronic Watery Diarrhea
symptoms.description: Persistent non-bloody diarrhea.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Mild to moderate cramping in the abdomen.

microscopic_colitis.onset: Often gradual, with symptoms lasting weeks to months.
microscopic_colitis.notes: Inflammation seen only on microscopic examination; more common in older adults.

symptoms.name: Progressive Weakness
symptoms.description: Slowly worsening weakness in the limbs.

symptoms.name: Sensory Loss
symptoms.description: Numbness or tingling in a “stocking-glove” distribution.

chronic_inflammatory_demyelinating_polyn.onset: Develops over at least 8 weeks with a relapsing–remitting course.
chronic_inflammatory_demyelinating_polyn.notes: An immune-mediated neuropathy that may respond to immunotherapy.

symptoms.name: Optic Neuritis
symptoms.description: Vision loss or pain with eye movement.

symptoms.name: Spinal Cord Inflammation
symptoms.description: Weakness, numbness, or paralysis of the limbs.

neuromyelitis_optica.onset: Often sudden in onset with relapses.
neuromyelitis_optica.notes: An autoimmune condition that primarily affects the optic nerves and spinal cord.

symptoms.name: Sudden Muscle Weakness
symptoms.description: Brief episodes of muscle paralysis triggered by strong emotions.

symptoms.name: Loss of Muscle Tone
symptoms.description: Temporary inability to move, without loss of consciousness.

cataplexy.onset: Typically occurs during periods of strong emotional stimulation.
cataplexy.notes: Commonly associated with narcolepsy; managed with medications.

symptoms.name: Hemolytic Anemia
symptoms.description: Low red blood cell count leading to fatigue and pallor.

symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.description: Yellowing of the skin and eyes due to bilirubin buildup.

symptoms.name: Splenomegaly
symptoms.description: Enlargement of the spleen as it filters abnormal cells.

hereditary_spherocytosis.onset: Usually identified in childhood, though severity varies.
hereditary_spherocytosis.notes: A genetic disorder causing spherical red blood cells that are prone to destruction.

symptoms.name: Oliguria
symptoms.description: Significantly reduced urine output.

symptoms.name: Fluid Overload
symptoms.description: Swelling and edema due to impaired kidney function.

symptoms.name: Electrolyte Imbalance
symptoms.description: Abnormal levels of potassium and other electrolytes.

acute_tubular_necrosis.onset: Rapid development over hours to days after an insult.
acute_tubular_necrosis.notes: Often seen after severe infections, toxins, or ischemia; may be reversible.

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.description: A sudden onset of high temperature.

symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.description: Skin eruptions that may appear alongside kidney dysfunction.

symptoms.name: Kidney Dysfunction
symptoms.description: Elevated creatinine and reduced kidney function.

acute_interstitial_nephritis.onset: Typically develops days to weeks after exposure to a trigger (e.g., medications).
acute_interstitial_nephritis.notes: An allergic reaction in the kidneys that is often reversible once the trigger is removed.

symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.description: Yellow discoloration of the skin and eyes in infants.

symptoms.name: Pale Stools
symptoms.description: Light-colored or clay-colored stools.

symptoms.name: Hepatomegaly
symptoms.description: Enlarged liver detectable on physical exam.

biliary_atresia.onset: Presents in infancy, usually within the first 2 months of life.
biliary_atresia.notes: A life‐threatening condition that requires prompt surgical intervention.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Intermittent pain in the upper right quadrant.

symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.description: Yellowing of the skin due to bile duct obstruction.

symptoms.name: Palpable Abdominal Mass
symptoms.description: A mass may be felt on physical examination in some cases.

choledochal_cyst.onset: Typically diagnosed in childhood but can present in adults.
choledochal_cyst.notes: Congenital malformation of the bile ducts that may require surgical excision.

symptoms.name: Joint Pain
symptoms.description: Deep, aching pain in the affected joint.

symptoms.name: Limited Range of Motion
symptoms.description: Stiffness and reduced mobility of the joint.

avascular_necrosis.onset: Insidious onset, often following steroid use or trauma.
avascular_necrosis.notes: Bone tissue dies due to lack of blood supply; treatment may be conservative or surgical.

symptoms.name: Flaccid Blisters
symptoms.description: Fragile blisters on the skin and mucous membranes that easily rupture.

symptoms.name: Painful Erosions
symptoms.description: Raw, painful areas after blisters rupture.

pemphigus_vulgaris.onset: Gradual onset in middle-aged or elderly patients.
pemphigus_vulgaris.notes: An autoimmune disorder requiring immunosuppressive therapy.

symptoms.name: Tense Blisters
symptoms.description: Firm, fluid-filled blisters typically on the trunk and limbs.

symptoms.name: Intense Itching
symptoms.description: Severe pruritus often preceding blister formation.

bullous_pemphigoid.onset: Usually appears in elderly individuals, with gradual onset.
bullous_pemphigoid.notes: Less severe than pemphigus vulgaris and managed with steroids and immunosuppressants.

symptoms.name: Red, Scaly Patches
symptoms.description: Discoid lesions typically on sun-exposed areas.

symptoms.name: Skin Atrophy
symptoms.description: Thinning and scarring of the affected skin.

discoid_lupus_erythematosus.onset: Chronic course, often exacerbated by sunlight exposure.
discoid_lupus_erythematosus.notes: A chronic cutaneous form of lupus that rarely progresses to systemic disease.

symptoms.name: Flashes of Light
symptoms.description: Brief bursts of light in the peripheral vision.

symptoms.name: Floaters
symptoms.description: Small dark spots drifting in the field of vision.

symptoms.name: Curtain-Like Vision Loss
symptoms.description: A shadow or veil obscuring part of the visual field.

retinal_detachment.onset: Sudden onset; considered a medical emergency.
retinal_detachment.notes: Requires prompt surgical repair to prevent permanent vision loss.

symptoms.name: Floaters
symptoms.description: Specks or clouds in the vision.

symptoms.name: Blurred Vision
symptoms.description: Progressive loss of visual clarity.

symptoms.name: Visual Field Defects
symptoms.description: Gaps or missing areas in the visual field.

cytomegalovirus_retinitis.onset: Often in immunocompromised individuals, progressing over weeks.
cytomegalovirus_retinitis.notes: A sight-threatening infection most common in advanced HIV/AIDS.

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.description: Persistent high temperature despite antibiotic treatment.

symptoms.name: Chills
symptoms.description: Severe shivering and cold sweats.

symptoms.name: Organ Dysfunction
symptoms.description: Signs of sepsis with possible multi-organ involvement.

invasive_candidiasis.onset: Rapid onset in hospitalized or immunocompromised patients.
invasive_candidiasis.notes: A systemic fungal infection requiring prompt antifungal therapy.

symptoms.name: Muscle Pain
symptoms.description: Severe muscle aches, particularly in the calves.

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.description: High temperature during the acute phase.

symptoms.name: Periorbital Edema
symptoms.description: Swelling around the eyes.

trichinosis.onset: Symptoms usually develop 1–2 weeks after ingestion of undercooked meat.
trichinosis.notes: A parasitic infection caused by Trichinella species; treated with antihelminthic medications.

symptoms.name: Lymphadenopathy
symptoms.description: Enlarged, tender lymph nodes, especially in the neck.

symptoms.name: Flu-like Symptoms
symptoms.description: Mild fever, muscle aches, and fatigue.

symptoms.name: Ocular Involvement
symptoms.description: Blurred vision or eye pain if the retina is affected.

toxoplasmosis.onset: Often asymptomatic in healthy individuals; severe in immunocompromised or congenitally infected.
toxoplasmosis.notes: Caused by the parasite Toxoplasma gondii; treatment is indicated in severe or ocular cases.

symptoms.name: Painless Skin Lesion
symptoms.description: A black eschar that forms on the skin following exposure.

symptoms.name: Fever and Chills
symptoms.description: Systemic signs in inhalational anthrax.

anthrax.onset: Cutaneous anthrax develops over several days; inhalational anthrax can progress rapidly.
anthrax.notes: A zoonotic disease that can be life-threatening; prompt antibiotic treatment is essential.

symptoms.name: High Fever
symptoms.description: Sudden onset of high fever in infants.

symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.description: A pinkish rash that appears after the fever subsides.

roseola.onset: Typically affects infants and toddlers; fever lasts a few days before the rash develops.
roseola.notes: A common viral infection usually caused by human herpesvirus 6.

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.description: Mild to moderate fever accompanied by malaise.

symptoms.name: Respiratory Symptoms
symptoms.description: Cough, sore throat, and congestion.

symptoms.name: Conjunctivitis
symptoms.description: Red, irritated eyes in some cases.

adenovirus_infection.notes: Typically self-limited and common in children; supportive care is the mainstay.

symptoms.name: Skin Thickening
symptoms.description: Induration and tightness of the skin over the limbs.

symptoms.name: Pain and Stiffness
symptoms.description: Discomfort and limited mobility in affected areas.

eosinophilic_fasciitis.onset: Subacute onset over weeks to months.
eosinophilic_fasciitis.notes: A rare inflammatory condition of the fascia; treatment often involves corticosteroids.

symptoms.name: Cartilage Inflammation
symptoms.description: Pain, redness, and swelling in cartilage-rich areas such as the ears and nose.

symptoms.name: Respiratory Distress
symptoms.description: Hoarseness or breathing difficulties if the airway cartilage is involved.

relapsing_polychondritis.onset: Chronic, relapsing course with intermittent flares.
relapsing_polychondritis.notes: An autoimmune disorder affecting cartilage throughout the body.

symptoms.name: Sudden Intense Fear
symptoms.description: Abrupt episodes of overwhelming anxiety and fear.

symptoms.name: Palpitations
symptoms.description: Rapid or irregular heartbeat during an attack.

symptoms.name: Shortness of Breath
symptoms.description: Difficulty breathing during an episode.

panic_disorder.onset: Episodic onset, often beginning in early adulthood.
panic_disorder.notes: Often associated with anticipatory anxiety; treatment may include therapy and medications.

symptoms.name: Attention-Seeking Behavior
symptoms.description: Exaggerated emotional expression to gain approval.

symptoms.name: Shallow Emotions
symptoms.description: Rapidly shifting and shallow affect.

histrionic_personality_disorder.onset: Emerged in early adulthood, as personality patterns develop.
histrionic_personality_disorder.notes: A personality disorder characterized by dramatic, emotional behavior.

symptoms.name: Distrust
symptoms.description: Persistent suspicion of others’ motives without justification.

symptoms.name: Reluctance to Confide
symptoms.description: Difficulty trusting others with personal information.

paranoid_personality_disorder.notes: A chronic condition that can affect interpersonal relationships and functioning.

symptoms.name: Social Withdrawal
symptoms.description: Lack of desire for close relationships or social interactions.

symptoms.name: Emotional Detachment
symptoms.description: Limited range of emotional expression.

schizoid_personality_disorder.onset: Patterns usually become noticeable in early adulthood.
schizoid_personality_disorder.notes: Individuals often appear aloof and indifferent to praise or criticism.

symptoms.name: Social Inhibition
symptoms.description: Avoidance of social interaction due to fear of criticism.

symptoms.name: Feelings of Inadequacy
symptoms.description: Strong belief of being socially inept or inferior.

avoidant_personality_disorder.onset: Emerges in early adulthood and persists over time.
avoidant_personality_disorder.notes: May lead to significant distress and avoidance of social situations.

symptoms.name: Excessive Need to Be Taken Care Of
symptoms.description: Reliance on others for decision-making and reassurance.

symptoms.name: Fear of Abandonment
symptoms.description: Intense worry about separation or loss of support.

dependent_personality_disorder.notes: Results in clinging behavior and difficulty functioning independently.

symptoms.name: Regurgitation of Food
symptoms.description: Repeatedly bringing up recently ingested food without nausea.

symptoms.name: No Intent to Vomit
symptoms.description: Distinct from typical vomiting as the food is re-chewed or re-swallowed.

rumination_disorder.onset: Often seen in infants and individuals with developmental disabilities.
rumination_disorder.notes: Not attributable to another medical condition; management focuses on behavioral interventions.

symptoms.name: Recurrent Severe Vomiting
symptoms.description: Episodes of intense vomiting that occur in cycles.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Pain that accompanies vomiting episodes.

cyclic_vomiting_syndrome.onset: Episodes may begin in childhood and recur periodically.
cyclic_vomiting_syndrome.notes: The exact cause is unknown; management focuses on symptom control and trigger avoidance.

symptoms.name: Chronic Respiratory Infections
symptoms.description: Frequent sinus and lung infections due to impaired ciliary function.

symptoms.name: Persistent Nasal Congestion
symptoms.description: Long-term nasal blockage and discharge.

primary_ciliary_dyskinesia.notes: A genetic disorder affecting the motility of cilia; treatment is mainly supportive.

symptoms.name: Elevated Eosinophil Count
symptoms.description: Marked increase in eosinophils on blood tests.

symptoms.name: Organ Damage
symptoms.description: Damage to heart, skin, or lungs due to eosinophil infiltration.

idiopathic_hypereosinophilic_syndrome.notes: A rare disorder that requires exclusion of secondary causes of eosinophilia.

symptoms.name: Dysphagia
symptoms.description: Difficulty swallowing, especially solids.

symptoms.name: Food Impaction
symptoms.description: Sensation of food getting stuck in the esophagus.

esophageal_stricture.onset: Progressive over time, often after chronic acid reflux or injury.
esophageal_stricture.notes: Narrowing of the esophagus that may require dilation procedures.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Cramping pain often accompanied by diarrhea.

symptoms.name: Weight Loss
symptoms.description: Unintentional loss of weight over time.

eosinophilic_gastroenteritis.onset: May develop gradually with recurrent gastrointestinal symptoms.
eosinophilic_gastroenteritis.notes: A rare inflammatory condition characterized by eosinophilic infiltration of the gastrointestinal tract.

symptoms.name: Bloating
symptoms.description: Abdominal distension and discomfort.

symptoms.name: Constipation
symptoms.description: Difficulty passing stool due to slowed intestinal transit.

intestinal_dysmotility.notes: A disorder of abnormal muscle movement in the intestines; management is supportive.

symptoms.name: Stomach Pain
symptoms.description: Chronic discomfort or burning in the upper abdomen.

symptoms.name: Anemia
symptoms.description: Pallor and fatigue due to vitamin B12 deficiency.

autoimmune_gastritis.onset: Gradual onset with chronic inflammation of the stomach lining.
autoimmune_gastritis.notes: An autoimmune destruction of parietal cells leading to decreased intrinsic factor production.

symptoms.name: Urinary Frequency
symptoms.description: Increased urge to urinate frequently.

symptoms.name: Suprapubic Pain
symptoms.description: Discomfort in the lower abdominal region.

eosinophilic_cystitis.onset: May occur subacutely over days to weeks.
eosinophilic_cystitis.notes: A rare inflammatory condition of the bladder wall marked by eosinophilic infiltration.

symptoms.name: Difficulty Urinating
symptoms.description: Hesitancy or incomplete bladder emptying.

symptoms.name: Urinary Incontinence
symptoms.description: Loss of bladder control leading to leakage.

bladder_neurogenic_dysfunction.onset: Often gradual, related to neurological injury or disease.
bladder_neurogenic_dysfunction.notes: Results from disruption in the nerve signals controlling bladder function.

symptoms.name: Painful Erections
symptoms.description: Discomfort during an erection due to fibrous plaque formation.

symptoms.name: Curvature of the Penis
symptoms.description: Abnormal bending or deformity during erection.

penile_fibrosis.notes: Often associated with Peyronie’s disease; treatment may include medications or surgery.

symptoms.name: Amenorrhea
symptoms.description: Early cessation of menstrual periods.

symptoms.name: Hot Flashes
symptoms.description: Sudden episodes of intense warmth and sweating.

premature_ovarian_failure.onset: Occurs before the age of 40, often with an abrupt decline in ovarian function.
premature_ovarian_failure.notes: May result in infertility and long-term health consequences related to estrogen deficiency.

symptoms.name: Lower Back Pain
symptoms.description: Pain localized to the lumbar region, often worsened by activity.

symptoms.name: Stiffness
symptoms.description: Reduced flexibility and muscle tightness in the back.

spondylolysis.onset: Common in adolescents and young athletes.
spondylolysis.notes: A stress fracture in the pars interarticularis of the vertebra; often managed conservatively.

symptoms.name: Joint Pain
symptoms.description: Episodes of acute joint pain and swelling, often affecting the knee.

symptoms.name: Stiffness
symptoms.description: Difficulty moving the affected joint.

chondrocalcinosis.onset: Typically intermittent, with acute attacks lasting days.
chondrocalcinosis.notes: Deposition of calcium pyrophosphate crystals in joints; sometimes called pseudogout.

symptoms.name: Joint Locking
symptoms.description: Intermittent episodes where the joint feels stuck.

symptoms.name: Pain and Swelling
symptoms.description: Localized pain that worsens with joint movement.

osteochondritis_dissecans.onset: Often develops in adolescents and young adults after repetitive trauma.
osteochondritis_dissecans.notes: A joint condition in which a segment of bone and cartilage becomes ischemic and separates from the surrounding tissue.

symptoms.name: Joint Swelling
symptoms.description: Persistent swelling and warmth in one or more joints.

symptoms.name: Morning Stiffness
symptoms.description: Stiffness in the joints after waking up that improves with movement.

juvenile_idiopathic_arthritis.onset: Begins before the age of 16, with varying patterns of joint involvement.
juvenile_idiopathic_arthritis.notes: An umbrella term for several types of arthritis in children; treatment is tailored to the subtype.

symptoms.name: Throat Burning or Tingling
symptoms.description: An abnormal, persistent burning or tingling sensation in the back of the throat and posterior tongue.

symptoms.name: Referred Ear Pain
symptoms.description: Sharp, stabbing pain radiating to the ear, often triggered by swallowing or speaking.

symptoms.name: Dysphagia
symptoms.description: Difficulty swallowing, sometimes accompanied by a sensation of a lump in the throat.

symptoms.name: Exaggerated Gag Reflex
symptoms.description: Heightened sensitivity in the throat leading to an increased gag reflex during eating or talking.

glossopharyngeal_dysesthesia.onset: Episodes can occur suddenly, often triggered by swallowing, chewing, or speaking, and may last from a few seconds to several minutes.
glossopharyngeal_dysesthesia.notes: A rare condition that may overlap with glossopharyngeal neuralgia. Diagnosis relies on clinical history and exclusion of other oropharyngeal pain disorders. Treatment options include anticonvulsant medications, nerve blocks, or surgical intervention for refractory cases.

symptoms.name: Skin Rash
symptoms.description: Red or brownish papules or scaly lesions, often on the scalp or trunk.

symptoms.name: Bone Pain
symptoms.description: Pain in affected bones due to lytic lesions.

symptoms.name: Pituitary Dysfunction
symptoms.description: Symptoms such as diabetes insipidus (excessive thirst and urination).

langerhans_cell_histiocytosis.onset: Typically presents in childhood but can occur at any age.
langerhans_cell_histiocytosis.notes: A rare disorder involving clonal proliferation of Langerhans cells; treatment varies from observation to chemotherapy.

symptoms.name: Wheezing
symptoms.description: Recurrent episodes of wheezing and coughing.

symptoms.name: Cough with Mucus
symptoms.description: Productive cough with thick, brownish mucus plugs.

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.description: Low-grade fever during acute episodes.

allergic_bronchopulmonary_aspergillosis.onset: Often develops in patients with asthma or cystic fibrosis.
allergic_bronchopulmonary_aspergillosis.notes: An allergic reaction to Aspergillus spores; managed with corticosteroids and antifungals.

symptoms.name: Progressive Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Increasing shortness of breath, especially on exertion.

symptoms.name: Dry Cough
symptoms.description: Persistent, non-productive cough that worsens over time.

idiopathic_pulmonary_fibrosis.onset: Gradual onset over several months to years.
idiopathic_pulmonary_fibrosis.notes: A chronic, progressive fibrosing interstitial pneumonia of unknown cause; prognosis is generally poor.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: Persistent tiredness and weakness.

symptoms.name: Splenomegaly
symptoms.description: Enlarged spleen causing discomfort or a feeling of fullness.

symptoms.name: Recurrent Infections
symptoms.description: Increased susceptibility to bacterial infections.

hairy_cell_leukemia.onset: Usually seen in middle-aged adults with an indolent course.
hairy_cell_leukemia.notes: A rare, chronic B-cell leukemia that often responds well to purine analog therapy.

symptoms.name: Memory Loss
symptoms.description: Rapidly progressive impairment in short-term memory.

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.description: New-onset seizures, often refractory to standard treatment.

symptoms.name: Psychiatric Symptoms
symptoms.description: Behavioral changes, hallucinations, or delusions.

autoimmune_encephalitis.onset: Subacute onset over days to weeks.
autoimmune_encephalitis.notes: An inflammatory brain disorder that often requires immunotherapy.

symptoms.name: Mood Changes
symptoms.description: Depression, anxiety, or irritability.

symptoms.name: Memory Impairment
symptoms.description: Short-term memory loss and confusion.

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.description: Focal seizures affecting the temporal lobes.

limbic_encephalitis.notes: Often paraneoplastic or autoimmune in origin; early treatment improves outcomes.

symptoms.name: Nocturnal Motor Events
symptoms.description: Complex, often bizarre movements during sleep.

symptoms.name: Arousals
symptoms.description: Frequent awakenings or disrupted sleep.

sleep_related_hypermotor_epilepsy.onset: Occurs exclusively during sleep, often beginning in childhood or adolescence.
sleep_related_hypermotor_epilepsy.notes: A form of focal epilepsy that may require video-EEG monitoring for diagnosis.

symptoms.name: Dizziness
symptoms.description: Lightheadedness or fainting on standing.

symptoms.name: Palpitations
symptoms.description: Rapid or irregular heartbeat.

symptoms.name: Gastrointestinal Disturbances
symptoms.description: Nausea, bloating, or alternating diarrhea and constipation.

dysautonomia.onset: Symptoms may appear gradually and vary in severity.
dysautonomia.notes: A broad term for disorders of the autonomic nervous system; treatment is symptomatic.

symptoms.name: Flushing
symptoms.description: Sudden reddening of the skin, often on the face or neck.

symptoms.name: Itching
symptoms.description: Generalized pruritus without an obvious rash.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Cramping and discomfort following meals.

mast_cell_activation_syndrome.onset: Episodes may occur unpredictably or be triggered by certain foods or stress.
mast_cell_activation_syndrome.notes: A condition in which mast cells release mediators inappropriately; management may include antihistamines and mast cell stabilizers.

symptoms.name: Lens Dislocation
symptoms.description: Displacement of the eye’s crystalline lens.

symptoms.name: Developmental Delay
symptoms.description: Cognitive impairment and delayed milestones.

symptoms.name: Thromboembolic Events
symptoms.description: Increased risk of blood clots leading to strokes or heart attacks.

homocystinuria.onset: Often identified in childhood through newborn screening or clinical features.
homocystinuria.notes: A metabolic disorder caused by enzyme deficiency; treatment includes dietary modification and vitamin supplementation.

symptoms.name: Hypopigmentation
symptoms.description: Light skin, hair, and eye color due to reduced melanin production.

symptoms.name: Visual Impairment
symptoms.description: Problems with vision including photophobia and nystagmus.

albinism.onset: Present from birth as a genetic condition.
albinism.notes: A group of inherited disorders affecting melanin synthesis; management focuses on vision support and skin protection.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: Persistent tiredness and lack of energy.

symptoms.name: Pruritus
symptoms.description: Intense itching without an obvious rash.

symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.description: Yellowing of the skin and eyes.

autoimmune_cholangitis.onset: Insidious onset over months to years.
autoimmune_cholangitis.notes: A rare chronic inflammatory liver disease affecting the bile ducts; often managed with ursodeoxycholic acid and immunosuppressants.

symptoms.name: Photosensitivity
symptoms.description: Skin blistering and pain on sun-exposed areas.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Severe, crampy pain in the abdomen during attacks.

porphyria_variegata.onset: Attacks are intermittent and can be triggered by certain drugs or stress.
porphyria_variegata.notes: A form of porphyria characterized by both neurovisceral and cutaneous symptoms; requires avoidance of triggers.

symptoms.name: Adrenal Insufficiency
symptoms.description: Symptoms include fatigue, hypotension, and electrolyte imbalances.

symptoms.name: Alacrima
symptoms.description: Absent or reduced tear production causing dry eyes.

symptoms.name: Achalasia
symptoms.description: Difficulty swallowing due to esophageal motility disorder.

triple_a_syndrome.onset: Typically presents in childhood or adolescence.
triple_a_syndrome.notes: A rare autosomal recessive disorder; treatment is multidisciplinary addressing each component.

symptoms.name: Chronic Cough
symptoms.description: A persistent cough, often nonproductive.

symptoms.name: Progressive Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Gradually worsening shortness of breath.

symptoms.name: Lymphadenopathy
symptoms.description: Enlarged lymph nodes in the chest or neck.

granulomatous_lymphocytic_interstitial_l.onset: Develops gradually over months, often in immunocompromised patients.
granulomatous_lymphocytic_interstitial_l.notes: A rare lung disorder seen in association with immune dysregulation; diagnosis is confirmed via lung biopsy.

symptoms.name: Proximal Muscle Weakness
symptoms.description: Severe weakness of the arms and legs.

symptoms.name: Elevated Creatine Kinase
symptoms.description: High levels of muscle enzymes indicating muscle damage.

immune_mediated_necrotizing_myopathy.onset: Subacute onset over weeks to months.
immune_mediated_necrotizing_myopathy.notes: An autoimmune muscle disease requiring immunosuppressive treatment.

symptoms.name: Joint Pain
symptoms.description: Pain and stiffness in the joints.

symptoms.name: Dry Cough
symptoms.description: Persistent cough without sputum production.

symptoms.name: Shortness of Breath
symptoms.description: Difficulty breathing on exertion.

myositis_associated_interstitial_lung_di.onset: Often occurs in patients with underlying myositis over several months.
myositis_associated_interstitial_lung_di.notes: Represents pulmonary involvement in inflammatory muscle disease; treatment is based on immunosuppression.

symptoms.name: Purpura
symptoms.description: Reddish-purple spots on the skin due to small vessel inflammation.

symptoms.name: Arthralgia
symptoms.description: Joint pain without significant swelling.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: Generalized tiredness during flare-ups.

cryoglobulinemic_vasculitis.onset: Episodes may be recurrent and are often associated with hepatitis C infection.
cryoglobulinemic_vasculitis.notes: A small-vessel vasculitis caused by cryoglobulin deposition; treatment involves addressing the underlying cause.

symptoms.name: Interstitial Keratitis
symptoms.description: Inflammation of the cornea causing eye pain and blurred vision.

symptoms.name: Hearing Loss
symptoms.description: Sudden or progressive loss of hearing, often with vertigo.

cogan_syndrome.onset: Subacute onset over weeks with relapsing episodes.
cogan_syndrome.notes: A rare autoimmune disorder affecting the eyes and ears; early treatment may prevent permanent deficits.

symptoms.name: Cough
symptoms.description: Persistent cough often associated with lung nodules.

symptoms.name: Fever and Weight Loss
symptoms.description: Systemic symptoms including unexplained weight loss.

lymphomatoid_granulomatosis.onset: Gradual onset with systemic and pulmonary manifestations.
lymphomatoid_granulomatosis.notes: A rare lymphoproliferative disorder that primarily affects the lungs; treatment includes chemotherapy.

symptoms.name: Generalized Lymphadenopathy
symptoms.description: Enlarged lymph nodes in multiple regions.

symptoms.name: Fever and Fatigue
symptoms.description: Constitutional symptoms that persist over time.

idiopathic_multicentric_castleman_diseas.onset: Chronic onset over months with relapsing symptoms.
idiopathic_multicentric_castleman_diseas.notes: A rare lymphoproliferative disorder of unknown cause; treatment may involve immunotherapy and corticosteroids.

symptoms.name: Chronic Pain
symptoms.description: Persistent pain often localized to nerve pathways.

symptoms.name: Nerve Tumors
symptoms.description: Multiple benign tumors along peripheral nerves.

schwannomatosis.onset: Typically presents in adulthood with gradual progression.
schwannomatosis.notes: A rare disorder related to neurofibromatosis but without vestibular tumors; management is symptomatic.

symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.description: Yellowing of the skin and eyes due to bile duct inflammation.

symptoms.name: Right Upper Quadrant Pain
symptoms.description: Discomfort in the liver area.

eosinophilic_cholangitis.onset: Insidious onset with progressive cholestatic features.
eosinophilic_cholangitis.notes: A rare inflammatory condition of the bile ducts with eosinophilic infiltration; may mimic sclerosing cholangitis.

symptoms.name: Sudden Hearing Loss
symptoms.description: Rapid loss of hearing in one or both ears.

symptoms.name: Tinnitus
symptoms.description: Ringing or buzzing in the ears.

symptoms.name: Vertigo
symptoms.description: A sensation of spinning or imbalance.

autoimmune_inner_ear_disease.onset: Acute or subacute onset, sometimes fluctuating.
autoimmune_inner_ear_disease.notes: An autoimmune process affecting the inner ear; early treatment with steroids may improve outcomes.

symptoms.name: Lobar Hemorrhage
symptoms.description: Recurrent brain bleeds typically in the cerebral lobes.

symptoms.name: Cognitive Decline
symptoms.description: Progressive memory loss and confusion.

cerebral_amyloid_angiopathy.onset: Often in older adults with a gradual decline punctuated by hemorrhagic events.
cerebral_amyloid_angiopathy.notes: A condition in which amyloid deposits weaken cerebral vessel walls; a common cause of intracerebral hemorrhage in the elderly.

symptoms.name: Severe Headache
symptoms.description: Persistent headache that may be accompanied by vomiting.

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.description: Focal or generalized seizures due to impaired venous drainage.

symptoms.name: Papilledema
symptoms.description: Swelling of the optic disc observed on eye examination.

cerebral_sinovenous_thrombosis.notes: A rare type of stroke due to clot formation in the cerebral venous sinuses; requires prompt anticoagulation.

symptoms.name: Numbness and Tingling
symptoms.description: Abnormal sensations, usually in a “stocking-glove” distribution.

symptoms.name: Burning Pain
symptoms.description: A persistent burning sensation in the hands and feet.

peripheral_neuropathy.onset: Gradual onset over months to years, depending on the cause.
peripheral_neuropathy.notes: Can be caused by diabetes, toxins, or autoimmune disorders; treatment is based on addressing the underlying etiology.

symptoms.name: Postprandial Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Severe abdominal pain after eating.

symptoms.name: Weight Loss
symptoms.description: Unintentional weight loss due to fear of eating.

mesenteric_ischemia.onset: Typically occurs in older adults with vascular disease.
mesenteric_ischemia.notes: Caused by reduced blood flow to the intestines; may require surgical revascularization.

symptoms.name: Right Upper Quadrant Pain
symptoms.description: Abdominal pain after eating fatty meals.

symptoms.name: Nausea
symptoms.description: Mild to moderate nausea during episodes.

gallbladder_dyskinesia.onset: Often chronic and recurrent, linked to meals.
gallbladder_dyskinesia.notes: A functional gallbladder disorder diagnosed by abnormal ejection fraction on HIDA scan.

symptoms.name: Painless Mass
symptoms.description: A firm, immobile mass, often in the abdominal wall.

symptoms.name: Local Discomfort
symptoms.description: Mild pain or pressure sensation near the mass.

desmoid_tumor.onset: Slow-growing, often discovered incidentally or during evaluation of a mass.
desmoid_tumor.notes: A benign fibrous neoplasm that may be locally aggressive; treatment options vary from observation to surgery.

symptoms.name: Painless Mass
symptoms.description: A slowly enlarging mass that may be deep-seated.

symptoms.name: Local Pain
symptoms.description: Discomfort if the tumor compresses surrounding tissues.

hemangiopericytoma.notes: A rare soft-tissue tumor arising from pericytes; treatment often involves surgical excision.

symptoms.name: Headaches
symptoms.description: Frequent, dull headaches due to gland enlargement.

symptoms.name: Vision Changes
symptoms.description: Blurred or double vision if the optic chiasm is compressed.

symptoms.name: Hormonal Imbalances
symptoms.description: Symptoms vary depending on which pituitary hormones are affected.

pituitary_hyperplasia.notes: A non-neoplastic enlargement of the pituitary; management depends on the underlying hormonal disturbance.

symptoms.name: Involuntary Neck Contractions
symptoms.description: Muscle spasms causing abnormal head posture.

symptoms.name: Neck Pain
symptoms.description: Chronic pain in the neck and shoulders.

cervical_dystonia.onset: Usually appears in middle age with a gradual onset.
cervical_dystonia.notes: A movement disorder affecting the neck muscles; treated with botulinum toxin injections and muscle relaxants.

symptoms.name: Involuntary Facial Movements
symptoms.description: Repetitive twitching or grimacing of the facial muscles.

symptoms.name: Jaw Clenching
symptoms.description: Involuntary contractions of the jaw muscles leading to discomfort.

meige_syndrome.notes: A form of cranial dystonia; management includes medications and botulinum toxin injections.

symptoms.name: Irregular Tremor
symptoms.description: Shaking movements that occur with dystonic posturing.

symptoms.name: Abnormal Muscle Contractions
symptoms.description: Sustained muscle contractions leading to twisting movements.

dystonic_tremor.onset: Gradual onset, often associated with an underlying dystonia.
dystonic_tremor.notes: A movement disorder that combines features of tremor and dystonia; treatment is tailored to the individual.

symptoms.name: Bradykinesia
symptoms.description: Slowness of movement and reduced spontaneous activity.

symptoms.name: Rigidity
symptoms.description: Increased muscle tone causing stiffness.

symptoms.name: Cognitive Changes
symptoms.description: Memory and concentration difficulties following encephalitis.

parkinsonism_due_to_encephalitis.onset: Follows an episode of encephalitis, with gradual progression.
parkinsonism_due_to_encephalitis.notes: A secondary parkinsonian syndrome resulting from inflammatory brain injury; management is symptomatic.

symptoms.name: Muscle Weakness
symptoms.description: Progressive weakness especially in the proximal muscles.

symptoms.name: Muscle Pain
symptoms.description: Soreness and cramps following exertion.

alcoholic_myopathy.onset: Develops in chronic alcohol users over months to years.
alcoholic_myopathy.notes: A myopathy due to toxic effects of alcohol; abstinence and nutritional support are key components of treatment.

symptoms.name: Profound Muscle Weakness
symptoms.description: Severe, generalized weakness following prolonged intensive care.

symptoms.name: Difficulty Weaning from Ventilator
symptoms.description: Weak respiratory muscles leading to prolonged ventilatory support.

critical_illness_myopathy.onset: Occurs after a critical illness, often during or after intensive care.
critical_illness_myopathy.notes: An acquired muscle weakness condition in critically ill patients; recovery may be prolonged with rehabilitation.

symptoms.name: Exercise Intolerance
symptoms.description: Rapid fatigue and muscle pain with exertion.

symptoms.name: Muscle Weakness
symptoms.description: Chronic weakness that may affect multiple muscle groups.

symptoms.name: Lactic Acidosis
symptoms.description: Increased lactic acid levels causing muscle cramps and pain.

mitochondrial_myopathy.onset: Often presents in childhood or early adulthood with variable progression.
mitochondrial_myopathy.notes: A group of disorders caused by mitochondrial dysfunction; management is supportive and symptomatic.

symptoms.name: Transient Muscle Weakness
symptoms.description: Episodes of profound weakness, particularly in the limbs.

symptoms.name: Palpitations
symptoms.description: Rapid heartbeat associated with hyperthyroidism.

thyrotoxic_periodic_paralysis.onset: Typically occurs in hyperthyroid patients, often triggered by high-carbohydrate meals.
thyrotoxic_periodic_paralysis.notes: A rare complication of thyrotoxicosis; treatment includes management of the thyroid disorder and potassium supplementation during attacks.

symptoms.name: Fatigable Weakness
symptoms.description: Muscle weakness that worsens with activity and improves with rest.

symptoms.name: Ocular Symptoms
symptoms.description: Ptosis and diplopia that may be present from birth.

congenital_myasthenic_syndrome.onset: Present from birth or early infancy.
congenital_myasthenic_syndrome.notes: A heterogeneous group of disorders affecting neuromuscular transmission; management is based on the specific subtype.

symptoms.name: Fluctuating Diplopia
symptoms.description: Intermittent double vision.

symptoms.name: Ptosis
symptoms.description: Drooping of one or both eyelids.

ocular_myasthenia.onset: Typically presents in adulthood with symptoms confined to the eyes.
ocular_myasthenia.notes: A form of myasthenia gravis affecting only the ocular muscles; treatment may include acetylcholinesterase inhibitors.

symptoms.name: Diplopia
symptoms.description: Double vision due to impaired eye movement.

symptoms.name: Limited Eye Movement
symptoms.description: Difficulty moving the eyes in certain directions.

autoimmune_oculomotor_paralysis.notes: A rare condition where autoantibodies impair ocular motor nerve function; treatment involves immunosuppression.

symptoms.name: Ptosis
symptoms.description: Drooping of the eyelids that worsens over time.

symptoms.name: Restricted Eye Movements
symptoms.description: Limited movement of the eyes in all directions.

chronic_progressive_external_ophthalmopl.onset: Gradual onset in childhood or early adulthood.
chronic_progressive_external_ophthalmopl.notes: A mitochondrial disorder affecting the extraocular muscles; management is supportive.

symptoms.name: Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Shortness of breath on exertion.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: General tiredness due to reduced cardiac output.

symptoms.name: Bounding Pulses
symptoms.description: A strong, forceful pulse due to high stroke volume.

aortic_regurgitation.notes: A condition where the aortic valve fails to close properly, leading to backflow of blood; treatment may involve valve repair or replacement.

symptoms.name: Peripheral Edema
symptoms.description: Swelling of the legs and ankles due to fluid retention.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: General weakness and tiredness.

symptoms.name: Jugular Venous Distension
symptoms.description: Visible distension of the neck veins.

tricuspid_regurgitation.onset: Often chronic, developing over time in the setting of right heart dysfunction.
tricuspid_regurgitation.notes: Regurgitation of the tricuspid valve can be secondary to other heart diseases; management is based on the underlying cause.

symptoms.name: Exertional Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Shortness of breath during physical activity.

symptoms.name: Chest Pain
symptoms.description: Discomfort or pain in the chest on exertion.

symptoms.name: Heart Murmur
symptoms.description: A systolic murmur detected on examination.

pulmonary_stenosis.onset: Typically a congenital condition that may be detected in childhood.
pulmonary_stenosis.notes: Narrowing of the pulmonary valve impeding blood flow; treatment may include balloon valvuloplasty or surgery.

symptoms.name: Bradycardia
symptoms.description: Slow heart rate detected in a neonate.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: Poor feeding and lethargy in infants.

congenital_heart_block.onset: Present at birth, often identified on routine neonatal screening.
congenital_heart_block.notes: A conduction abnormality in the heart that may require pacemaker insertion if severe.

symptoms.name: Palpitations
symptoms.description: Irregular heartbeats or rapid pulse.

symptoms.name: Syncope
symptoms.description: Episodes of fainting or near-fainting.

arrhythmogenic_right_ventricular_cardiom.onset: Typically presents in young adults with progressive symptoms.
arrhythmogenic_right_ventricular_cardiom.notes: A genetic disorder causing fibrofatty replacement of the right ventricular myocardium; management may include implantable cardioverter-defibrillators.

symptoms.name: Heart Failure Symptoms
symptoms.description: Shortness of breath, fatigue, and fluid retention.

symptoms.name: Arrhythmias
symptoms.description: Irregular heart rhythms that may cause palpitations.

noncompaction_cardiomyopathy.onset: Congenital condition that may present in infancy or later in life.
noncompaction_cardiomyopathy.notes: A structural abnormality of the heart muscle with deep trabeculations; management is based on heart failure guidelines.

symptoms.name: Chronic Respiratory Distress
symptoms.description: Persistent breathing difficulties in a preterm infant.

symptoms.name: Oxygen Dependency
symptoms.description: Need for prolonged supplemental oxygen.

bronchopulmonary_dysplasia.onset: Develops in premature infants following prolonged mechanical ventilation.
bronchopulmonary_dysplasia.notes: A form of chronic lung disease seen in neonates; treatment is supportive with oxygen and nutrition.

symptoms.name: Persistent Cough
symptoms.description: Chronic cough with sputum production.

symptoms.name: Exertional Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Shortness of breath during physical activity.

asthma_copd_overlap_syndrome.onset: Develops in middle-aged to older adults with a history of smoking and asthma.
asthma_copd_overlap_syndrome.notes: A syndrome with features of both asthma and COPD; management includes bronchodilators and inhaled corticosteroids.

symptoms.name: Progressive Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Gradually worsening shortness of breath.

symptoms.name: Dry Cough
symptoms.description: Persistent, nonproductive cough.

nonspecific_interstitial_pneumonitis.onset: Develops over months in patients with interstitial lung disease.
nonspecific_interstitial_pneumonitis.notes: A subtype of interstitial pneumonia with a more favorable prognosis than other forms; treated with corticosteroids.

symptoms.name: Nonproductive Cough
symptoms.description: A persistent, dry cough.

symptoms.name: Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Shortness of breath on exertion.

symptoms.name: Cystic Lung Lesions
symptoms.description: Abnormal cysts visible on imaging studies.

pulmonary_langerhans_cell_histiocytosis.onset: Typically seen in young adult smokers.
pulmonary_langerhans_cell_histiocytosis.notes: A rare interstitial lung disease; cessation of smoking is the mainstay of treatment.

symptoms.name: Exertional Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Shortness of breath during physical activity.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: Persistent tiredness with minimal exertion.

symptoms.name: Syncope
symptoms.description: Fainting episodes during exercise.

idiopathic_pulmonary_arterial_hypertensi.onset: Gradual onset in young to middle-aged adults.
idiopathic_pulmonary_arterial_hypertensi.notes: A rare and progressive disorder of the pulmonary vasculature; treatment includes vasodilators and supportive care.

symptoms.name: Shortness of Breath
symptoms.description: Worsening dyspnea on exertion.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: Generalized weakness due to impaired oxygenation.

chronic_thromboembolic_pulmonary_hyperte.onset: Develops after unresolved or recurrent pulmonary emboli.
chronic_thromboembolic_pulmonary_hyperte.notes: A form of pulmonary hypertension that may be treated with surgical endarterectomy or medical therapy.

symptoms.name: Dry Cough
symptoms.description: Persistent cough without mucus production.

symptoms.name: Progressive Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Gradually worsening shortness of breath.

pleuroparenchymal_fibroelastosis.notes: A rare form of interstitial lung disease affecting the pleura and adjacent lung parenchyma; prognosis is variable.

symptoms.name: Cough
symptoms.description: Dry, persistent cough following radiation therapy.

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.description: Low-grade fever accompanying respiratory symptoms.

symptoms.name: Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Shortness of breath, particularly on exertion.

radiation_pneumonitis.onset: Typically occurs 1–3 months after thoracic radiation therapy.
radiation_pneumonitis.notes: An inflammatory reaction to radiation exposure; management is with steroids and supportive care.

symptoms.name: Cough
symptoms.description: Persistent cough that does not respond to usual treatment.

symptoms.name: Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Shortness of breath and reduced exercise tolerance.

drug_induced_lung_disease.onset: Varies depending on the causative agent, from weeks to months after drug exposure.
drug_induced_lung_disease.notes: A diagnosis of exclusion; withdrawal of the offending drug is the first step in management.

symptoms.name: Hemoptysis
symptoms.description: Coughing up blood or blood-tinged sputum.

symptoms.name: Anemia
symptoms.description: Symptoms of low blood count, such as fatigue and pallor.

symptoms.name: Respiratory Distress
symptoms.description: Difficulty breathing due to bleeding into the lung tissue.

pulmonary_hemorrhage_syndrome.onset: Acute onset, often in the setting of autoimmune disease or severe infection.
pulmonary_hemorrhage_syndrome.notes: A life-threatening condition that requires urgent intervention and supportive care.

symptoms.name: Chest Pain
symptoms.description: Persistent pain on the affected side.

symptoms.name: Dyspnea
symptoms.description: Shortness of breath due to pleural involvement.

symptoms.name: Pleural Effusion
symptoms.description: Fluid accumulation in the pleural space.

primary_pleural_mesothelioma.onset: Typically occurs in older adults with a history of asbestos exposure.
primary_pleural_mesothelioma.notes: A rare, aggressive malignancy of the pleura; prognosis is generally poor.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Chronic pain or discomfort in the abdomen.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Distension
symptoms.description: Swelling due to fluid accumulation or tumor growth.

peritoneal_mesothelioma.onset: Usually insidious in onset in middle-aged individuals.
peritoneal_mesothelioma.notes: A rare malignancy of the peritoneum, often associated with asbestos exposure; treatment is multimodal.

symptoms.name: Joint Pain
symptoms.description: Pain and swelling in peripheral joints.

symptoms.name: Stiffness
symptoms.description: Morning stiffness that improves with activity.

enteropathic_arthritis.onset: Often occurs in patients with underlying inflammatory bowel disease.
enteropathic_arthritis.notes: An arthritis associated with gastrointestinal inflammation; management targets both joint and bowel symptoms.

symptoms.name: Back Stiffness
symptoms.description: Chronic stiffness, especially in the thoracic spine.

symptoms.name: Mild Back Pain
symptoms.description: Aching pain that is generally less severe than in inflammatory arthritis.

diffuse_idiopathic_skeletal_hyperostosis.onset: Typically appears in older adults, gradually progressing over time.
diffuse_idiopathic_skeletal_hyperostosis.notes: A noninflammatory condition characterized by ossification along the spine; often an incidental finding.

symptoms.name: Jaw Pain
symptoms.description: Persistent pain in the jaw, often after dental procedures.

symptoms.name: Exposed Bone
symptoms.description: Areas of necrotic bone visible in the oral cavity.

osteonecrosis_of_the_jaw.onset: May develop weeks to months after bisphosphonate therapy or radiation.
osteonecrosis_of_the_jaw.notes: A serious complication associated with certain medications; management includes conservative measures and sometimes surgical debridement.

symptoms.name: Occasional Headache
symptoms.description: Mild headaches that may be related to bony overgrowth.

hyperostosis_frontalis_interna.onset: Often an incidental finding in middle-aged women.
hyperostosis_frontalis_interna.notes: Characterized by thickening of the inner table of the frontal bone; typically asymptomatic and requires no treatment.

symptoms.name: Bone Pain
symptoms.description: Dull, aching pain in the affected bone.

symptoms.name: Bone Deformity
symptoms.description: Bony enlargement or deformity in the affected region.

fibrous_dysplasia.onset: Usually diagnosed in childhood or adolescence.
fibrous_dysplasia.notes: A benign bone disorder in which normal bone is replaced with fibrous tissue; management is conservative unless complications occur.

symptoms.name: Bone Fragility
symptoms.description: Paradoxical increased risk of fractures despite dense bones.

symptoms.name: Anemia
symptoms.description: Due to bone marrow failure as a result of sclerotic bone.

osteopetrosis.onset: Typically congenital; severity varies by type.
osteopetrosis.notes: A rare genetic disorder characterized by defective osteoclast-mediated bone resorption; treatment may include bone marrow transplant in severe cases.

symptoms.name: Bony Protrusions
symptoms.description: Multiple benign osteochondromas on long bones.

symptoms.name: Localized Pain
symptoms.description: Discomfort when exostoses compress surrounding tissues.

hereditary_multiple_exostoses.onset: Usually becomes evident in childhood and progresses during growth.
hereditary_multiple_exostoses.notes: An autosomal dominant disorder; surveillance is important due to a low risk of malignant transformation.

symptoms.name: Bone Deformities
symptoms.description: Irregular bone growths leading to deformity and fractures.

enchondromatosis.onset: Typically presents in childhood or adolescence.
enchondromatosis.notes: A condition characterized by multiple enchondromas; management is symptomatic and orthopedic intervention may be required.

symptoms.name: Limb Shortening
symptoms.description: Underdevelopment or absence of a portion of a limb.

hemimelia.notes: A rare congenital disorder affecting limb development; treatment may include orthopedic correction or prosthetics.

symptoms.name: Twisted Foot
symptoms.description: The foot is turned inward and downward.

symptoms.name: Difficulty Walking
symptoms.description: If untreated, abnormal gait and mobility issues develop.

clubfoot.onset: Present at birth as a congenital deformity.
clubfoot.notes: Early treatment with casting and possible surgery greatly improves outcomes.

symptoms.name: Hip Instability
symptoms.description: A feeling of the hip joint being loose or dislocated.

symptoms.name: Limping
symptoms.description: Abnormal gait in older infants or toddlers.

congenital_hip_dysplasia.onset: Typically identified in infancy during routine screening.
congenital_hip_dysplasia.notes: A developmental disorder of the hip joint; early intervention with bracing or surgery is critical.

symptoms.name: Abnormal Head Shape
symptoms.description: Irregular skull shape due to premature suture fusion.

symptoms.name: Developmental Delay
symptoms.description: Potential delays in cognitive and motor milestones.

craniosynostosis.onset: Present from birth, with skull abnormalities often noted in infancy.
craniosynostosis.notes: Requires surgical correction to allow normal brain growth and reduce intracranial pressure.

symptoms.name: Facial Deformity
symptoms.description: A visible split or opening in the upper lip and/or palate.

symptoms.name: Feeding Difficulties
symptoms.description: Problems with sucking and swallowing in infancy.

cleft_lip_and_palate.notes: A common congenital malformation that is corrected with surgical repair and supportive therapies.

symptoms.name: Skull Defect
symptoms.description: A protrusion of brain tissue through a defect in the skull.

symptoms.name: Neurological Deficits
symptoms.description: Variable symptoms including seizures or developmental delays.

encephalocele.onset: Congenital and identified at birth or early infancy.
encephalocele.notes: A neural tube defect that typically requires surgical repair.

symptoms.name: Heart Murmur
symptoms.description: A blowing murmur heard on auscultation.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: Decreased exercise tolerance due to inefficient heart function.

congenital_mitral_regurgitation.onset: Present at birth; may be asymptomatic initially.
congenital_mitral_regurgitation.notes: A congenital defect of the mitral valve leading to regurgitant flow; management depends on severity.

symptoms.name: Early Puberty
symptoms.description: Signs of premature sexual development.

symptoms.name: Ambiguous Genitalia
symptoms.description: Genital abnormalities evident at birth in severe cases.

adrenal_hyperplasia.onset: Congenital and often identified in infancy or early childhood.
adrenal_hyperplasia.notes: A group of disorders due to enzyme deficiencies affecting steroid synthesis; treatment may include hormone replacement.

symptoms.name: Salt Wasting
symptoms.description: Electrolyte imbalances leading to dehydration in neonates.

symptoms.name: Virilization
symptoms.description: Ambiguous genitalia in females or precocious puberty in males.

congenital_adrenal_hyperplasia.onset: Usually presents in infancy with life-threatening electrolyte disturbances.
congenital_adrenal_hyperplasia.notes: A specific form of adrenal hyperplasia requiring urgent management with glucocorticoids and mineralocorticoids.

symptoms.name: Tendon Xanthomas
symptoms.description: Cholesterol deposits in tendons, particularly in the Achilles tendon.

symptoms.name: Premature Coronary Artery Disease
symptoms.description: Early onset of heart disease even in young adults.

familial_hypercholesterolemia.onset: Genetic condition evident from childhood; cardiovascular events may occur in early adulthood.
familial_hypercholesterolemia.notes: An autosomal dominant disorder causing very high LDL cholesterol levels; aggressive lipid-lowering therapy is required.

symptoms.name: Eruptive Xanthomas
symptoms.description: Small, yellowish papules on the skin, especially on the buttocks.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Recurrent pain due to pancreatitis risk.

hypertriglyceridemia.onset: May be present from a young age; severity varies.
hypertriglyceridemia.notes: A lipid metabolism disorder that increases the risk for acute pancreatitis; managed with dietary changes and medications.

symptoms.name: Sudden Neck Pain
symptoms.description: Acute, severe pain on one side of the neck.

symptoms.name: Neurological Deficits
symptoms.description: Symptoms such as weakness or numbness due to reduced blood flow.

cervical_artery_dissection.onset: Often occurs suddenly, sometimes after minor trauma.
cervical_artery_dissection.notes: A tear in the wall of a cervical artery that can lead to stroke; treatment usually involves anticoagulation.

symptoms.name: Vertigo
symptoms.description: A spinning sensation, often accompanied by nausea.

symptoms.name: Neck Pain
symptoms.description: Pain in the posterior neck region.

symptoms.name: Stroke-like Symptoms
symptoms.description: Transient weakness or sensory loss.

vertebral_artery_dissection.onset: Sudden onset, often following trauma or vigorous neck movement.
vertebral_artery_dissection.notes: A tear in the vertebral artery wall leading to potential ischemic events; managed with anticoagulation or antiplatelet therapy.

symptoms.name: Orthostatic Headache
symptoms.description: Headache that worsens when standing and improves when lying down.

symptoms.name: Neck Stiffness
symptoms.description: Mild stiffness or pain in the neck.

spontaneous_intracranial_hypotension.onset: Develops suddenly or subacutely, often without a clear precipitating event.
spontaneous_intracranial_hypotension.notes: Caused by cerebrospinal fluid leak; treatment may involve bed rest, hydration, or epidural blood patch.

symptoms.name: Abnormal Thyroid Tests
symptoms.description: Low T3 and sometimes low T4 with normal TSH, usually without clinical symptoms.

sick_euthyroid_syndrome.onset: Occurs in the setting of acute or chronic systemic illness.
sick_euthyroid_syndrome.notes: A laboratory phenomenon rather than a true thyroid disorder; treatment focuses on the underlying illness.

symptoms.name: Tender Lymphadenopathy
symptoms.description: Enlarged, tender lymph nodes, usually in the cervical region.

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.description: High temperature often accompanied by night sweats.

kikuchi_disease.notes: A benign, self-limiting condition of unknown etiology; supportive care is typically sufficient.

symptoms.name: Respiratory Distress
symptoms.description: Shortness of breath and labored breathing.

symptoms.name: Chylous Effusions
symptoms.description: Accumulation of lymphatic fluid in the pleural or peritoneal cavity.

idiopathic_pulmonary_lymphangiectasia.onset: Typically presents in infancy or early childhood.
idiopathic_pulmonary_lymphangiectasia.notes: A rare disorder characterized by dilated lymphatic vessels in the lungs; treatment is largely supportive.

symptoms.name: Recurrent Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Severe cramping pain mimicking a mechanical obstruction.

symptoms.name: Bloating and Vomiting
symptoms.description: Symptoms similar to a bowel obstruction without a physical blockage.

chronic_intestinal_pseudo_obstruction.onset: Chronic, with intermittent exacerbations over years.
chronic_intestinal_pseudo_obstruction.notes: A motility disorder causing symptoms of obstruction; management includes nutritional support and prokinetic agents.

symptoms.name: Epigastric Discomfort
symptoms.description: Mild burning or discomfort in the upper abdomen.

symptoms.name: Iron Deficiency Anemia
symptoms.description: Pallor, fatigue, and lab findings of anemia.

autoimmune_gastric_atrophy.notes: An autoimmune destruction of the gastric mucosa leading to reduced acid and intrinsic factor production.

symptoms.name: Dysphagia
symptoms.description: Difficulty swallowing, particularly solids.

symptoms.name: Regurgitation
symptoms.description: Undigested food returning to the mouth.

symptoms.name: Halitosis
symptoms.description: Bad breath due to food stasis.

esophageal_diverticulum.onset: Usually develops in middle age; may be asymptomatic for years.
esophageal_diverticulum.notes: A pouch that forms in the esophageal wall; treatment may include endoscopic or surgical intervention.

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.description: Elevated temperature and malaise.

symptoms.name: Graft Tenderness
symptoms.description: Pain or tenderness over the transplanted organ.

symptoms.name: Organ Dysfunction
symptoms.description: Decline in organ function as indicated by laboratory tests.

acute_transplant_rejection.onset: Occurs days to weeks after transplantation.
acute_transplant_rejection.notes: A rapid immune-mediated response against the transplanted tissue; treated with high-dose immunosuppression.

symptoms.name: Gradual Organ Failure
symptoms.description: Slow decline in function of the transplanted organ.

symptoms.name: Mild Fever and Fatigue
symptoms.description: Non-specific symptoms accompanying declining graft function.

chronic_transplant_rejection.onset: Develops over months to years post-transplant.
chronic_transplant_rejection.notes: A slow immune-mediated injury to the transplant; management focuses on maintaining function and may require re-transplantation.

symptoms.name: Lymphadenopathy
symptoms.description: Enlarged lymph nodes, often generalized.

symptoms.name: Fever and Weight Loss
symptoms.description: Constitutional symptoms indicative of systemic involvement.

post_transplant_lymphoproliferative_diso.onset: Typically develops months to years after transplantation.
post_transplant_lymphoproliferative_diso.notes: A spectrum of lymphoid proliferations due to immunosuppression; treatment involves reducing immunosuppression and possibly chemotherapy.

symptoms.name: Easy Bruising
symptoms.description: Frequent or prolonged bleeding from minor injuries.

symptoms.name: Bleeding Gums
symptoms.description: Excessive bleeding during dental care or spontaneously.

factor_vii_deficiency.onset: A congenital bleeding disorder usually identified in childhood.
factor_vii_deficiency.notes: A rare coagulation disorder; management may include replacement therapy during surgical procedures.

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.description: Persistent tiredness and weakness.

symptoms.name: Weight Loss
symptoms.description: Unexplained loss of weight over time.

symptoms.name: Splenomegaly
symptoms.description: An enlarged spleen leading to fullness and discomfort.

chronic_neutrophilic_leukemia.onset: Often develops in middle age with an indolent course.
chronic_neutrophilic_leukemia.notes: A rare myeloproliferative disorder characterized by sustained neutrophilia; treatment is based on symptom control.

symptoms.name: Anemia
symptoms.description: Symptoms of low red blood cell count including fatigue and pallor.

symptoms.name: Hyperviscosity Syndrome
symptoms.description: Blurred vision and headaches due to thickened blood.

lymphoplasmacytic_lymphoma.notes: A rare indolent lymphoma often associated with IgM monoclonal gammopathy; treatment may involve rituximab.

symptoms.name: Focal Neurological Deficits
symptoms.description: Weakness, sensory changes, or speech difficulties depending on tumor location.

symptoms.name: Headache
symptoms.description: Persistent headache that may be accompanied by nausea.

primary_cns_lymphoma.onset: Typically presents in middle-aged or elderly patients over weeks.
primary_cns_lymphoma.notes: A rare form of non-Hodgkin lymphoma confined to the central nervous system; treatment involves high-dose methotrexate-based chemotherapy.

symptoms.name: Progressive Neurological Decline
symptoms.description: Gradual loss of cognitive and motor functions.

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.description: Recurrent seizures of varying types.

gliomatosis_cerebri.onset: Insidious onset over months with diffuse brain involvement.
gliomatosis_cerebri.notes: A rare, diffusely infiltrative glial tumor with a poor prognosis; treatment is largely palliative.

symptoms.name: Headache
symptoms.description: Severe headache often worse in the morning.

symptoms.name: Ataxia
symptoms.description: Loss of coordination and balance.

symptoms.name: Signs of Increased Intracranial Pressure
symptoms.description: Vomiting and papilledema on eye examination.

medulloblastoma.onset: Typically presents in children with rapid progression.
medulloblastoma.notes: A highly malignant cerebellar tumor; treatment involves surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy.

symptoms.name: Hormonal Imbalances
symptoms.description: Symptoms vary depending on which hormones are affected (e.g., fatigue, weight changes).

symptoms.name: Growth Abnormalities
symptoms.description: Delayed or accelerated growth in children.

hypothalamic_pituitary_axis_dysfunction.onset: Often chronic with subtle onset over years.
hypothalamic_pituitary_axis_dysfunction.notes: A dysfunction in the regulatory control of endocrine hormones; management depends on the specific hormonal deficits.

symptoms.name: Reduced Amniotic Fluid
symptoms.description: Detected on prenatal ultrasound as decreased fluid volume.

idiopathic_oligohydramnios.onset: Typically identified in the third trimester of pregnancy.
idiopathic_oligohydramnios.notes: A condition of unknown cause that may lead to fetal distress; careful monitoring and possible early delivery are required.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Intermittent right upper quadrant pain.

symptoms.name: Palpable Mass
symptoms.description: A liver mass may be felt on physical exam in some cases.

hepatic_adenoma.onset: Often detected incidentally in young women.
hepatic_adenoma.notes: A benign liver tumor associated with oral contraceptive use; risk of hemorrhage necessitates periodic monitoring.

symptoms.name: Jaundice
symptoms.description: Yellow discoloration of the skin due to bile duct obstruction.

symptoms.name: Weight Loss
symptoms.description: Unintentional weight loss over a short period.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Persistent pain in the right upper quadrant.

gallbladder_adenocarcinoma.onset: Typically occurs in older adults with a history of gallstones.
gallbladder_adenocarcinoma.notes: A malignant tumor of the gallbladder with a poor prognosis; early detection is rare.

symptoms.name: Asymptomatic
symptoms.description: Many hepatic cysts are found incidentally and cause no symptoms.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Discomfort
symptoms.description: Larger cysts may cause a dull ache in the upper abdomen.

hepatic_cyst.onset: Often congenital or acquired over time.
hepatic_cyst.notes: Most hepatic cysts are benign and require no treatment unless symptomatic.

symptoms.name: Localized Pain
symptoms.description: Pain near a palpable mass along a nerve.

symptoms.name: Numbness or Tingling
symptoms.description: Sensory changes in the distribution of the affected nerve.

peripheral_nerve_sheath_tumor.onset: Gradual onset over months to years.
peripheral_nerve_sheath_tumor.notes: A group of tumors that arise from the cells surrounding peripheral nerves; management is usually surgical excision if symptomatic.

symptoms.name: Firm, Painless Mass
symptoms.description: A solitary, well-circumscribed mass, often in infants.

myofibroma.onset: Typically congenital or noted in early infancy.
myofibroma.notes: A benign soft tissue tumor that may spontaneously regress; treatment is conservative unless complications occur.

symptoms.name: Brief Muscle Contractions
symptoms.description: Sudden, jerking movements or spasms, often in clusters.

symptoms.name: Developmental Regression
symptoms.description: Loss of previously acquired skills.

infantile_spasms.onset: Usually begins in infancy between 3 and 12 months of age.
infantile_spasms.notes: A severe epileptic encephalopathy; early treatment is critical to improve long-term outcomes.

symptoms.name: Brief Seizures
symptoms.description: Short, self-limited seizures occurring in infancy.

benign_familial_infantile_convulsions.onset: Typically presents in the first year of life with a benign course.
benign_familial_infantile_convulsions.notes: A genetic epilepsy syndrome with normal development between seizures; usually requires no long-term therapy.

symptoms.name: Acquired Aphasia
symptoms.description: Loss of language skills in a previously normal child.

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.description: Abnormal electrical activity in the brain, often with subtle motor manifestations.

landau_kleffner_syndrome.notes: A rare childhood epilepsy syndrome leading to language regression; management includes antiepileptic drugs and speech therapy.

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.description: Refractory seizures starting in infancy.

symptoms.name: Developmental Delay
symptoms.description: Impaired motor and cognitive development.

symptoms.name: Movement Disorders
symptoms.description: Abnormal involuntary movements and ataxia.

glucose_transporter_type1_deficiency.onset: Present from infancy, with symptoms typically emerging in the first year of life.
glucose_transporter_type1_deficiency.notes: A metabolic disorder affecting glucose transport into the brain; treatment involves a ketogenic diet.

symptoms.name: Lactic Acidosis
symptoms.description: Recurrent episodes of high lactic acid levels causing metabolic acidosis.

symptoms.name: Neurological Deficits
symptoms.description: Developmental delay, hypotonia, and poor coordination.

pyruvate_dehydrogenase_deficiency.onset: Often presents in infancy or early childhood.
pyruvate_dehydrogenase_deficiency.notes: A mitochondrial disorder affecting energy metabolism; management is supportive with nutritional therapy.

symptoms.name: Coarse Facial Features
symptoms.description: Distinctive facial appearance with thickened features.

symptoms.name: Organomegaly
symptoms.description: Enlarged liver and spleen.

symptoms.name: Skeletal Abnormalities
symptoms.description: Joint stiffness and dysostosis multiplex seen on X-ray.

mucopolysaccharidosis_type_i.onset: Typically in early childhood, with progressive multisystem involvement.
mucopolysaccharidosis_type_i.notes: A lysosomal storage disorder (Hurler syndrome in severe cases); enzyme replacement therapy is available.

symptoms.name: Coarse Facial Features
symptoms.description: Characteristic facies with thickened soft tissues.

symptoms.name: Skeletal Deformities
symptoms.description: Joint stiffness and abnormal bone growth.

symptoms.name: Developmental Delay
symptoms.description: Cognitive impairment and motor delays.

mucopolysaccharidosis_type_ii.notes: Also known as Hunter syndrome (X-linked recessive); treatment includes enzyme replacement.

symptoms.name: Severe Neurological Decline
symptoms.description: Progressive loss of cognitive and motor functions.

symptoms.name: Behavioral Problems
symptoms.description: Hyperactivity and sleep disturbances.

mucopolysaccharidosis_type_iii.onset: Symptoms typically begin in early childhood.
mucopolysaccharidosis_type_iii.notes: Known as Sanfilippo syndrome; primarily affects the central nervous system with limited somatic features.

symptoms.name: Skeletal Dysplasia
symptoms.description: Short stature and joint laxity.

symptoms.name: Joint Pain
symptoms.description: Painful and limited joint movements.

mucopolysaccharidosis_type_iv.notes: Also called Morquio syndrome; management is supportive and focuses on orthopedic issues.

symptoms.name: Coarse Facial Features
symptoms.description: Characteristic facial dysmorphism.

symptoms.name: Immunodeficiency
symptoms.description: Recurrent infections due to impaired immune function.

symptoms.name: Skeletal Abnormalities
symptoms.description: Joint stiffness and dysostosis.

alpha_mannosidosis.onset: Typically presents in early childhood with progressive symptoms.
alpha_mannosidosis.notes: A lysosomal storage disorder; treatment may include enzyme replacement therapy.

symptoms.name: Developmental Delay
symptoms.description: Delayed milestones and cognitive impairment.

symptoms.name: Angiokeratomas
symptoms.description: Dark red skin lesions that may appear in clusters.

symptoms.name: Skeletal Abnormalities
symptoms.description: Joint stiffness and dysostosis.

fucosidosis.notes: A rare lysosomal storage disorder; supportive care is the main treatment.

symptoms.name: Progressive Motor Decline
symptoms.description: Loss of coordination and motor skills.

symptoms.name: Cognitive Impairment
symptoms.description: Deterioration of intellectual function over time.

metachromatic_leukodystrophy.onset: Variable; can present in late infancy to adulthood.
metachromatic_leukodystrophy.notes: A demyelinating disorder due to arylsulfatase A deficiency; treatment is mainly supportive.

symptoms.name: Irritability
symptoms.description: Excessive fussiness and discomfort in infants.

symptoms.name: Spasticity
symptoms.description: Increased muscle tone leading to stiffness.

symptoms.name: Developmental Regression
symptoms.description: Loss of previously acquired skills.

krabbe_disease.onset: Typically presents in infancy with rapid progression.
krabbe_disease.notes: A severe neurodegenerative disorder due to galactocerebrosidase deficiency; prognosis is poor.

symptoms.name: Behavioral Changes
symptoms.description: Irritability, aggression, and cognitive decline.

symptoms.name: Adrenal Insufficiency
symptoms.description: Symptoms such as fatigue, weight loss, and hypotension.

adrenoleukodystrophy.onset: Typically manifests in childhood or adolescence.
adrenoleukodystrophy.notes: A genetic disorder affecting the nervous system and adrenal glands; management includes hormone replacement and supportive care.

symptoms.name: Coarse Facial Features
symptoms.description: Distinctive facial appearance with thickened features.

symptoms.name: Cardiomyopathy
symptoms.description: Heart muscle dysfunction leading to heart failure.

symptoms.name: Skeletal Abnormalities
symptoms.description: Joint stiffness and bone deformities.

galactosialidosis.onset: Variable; can present in childhood or adulthood.
galactosialidosis.notes: A rare lysosomal storage disorder; treatment is mainly supportive.

symptoms.name: Myoclonus
symptoms.description: Involuntary, sudden muscle jerks.

symptoms.name: Ataxia
symptoms.description: Loss of coordination and balance.

symptoms.name: Visual Impairment
symptoms.description: Difficulty with vision or abnormal eye movements.

sialidosis.onset: Usually begins in adolescence or early adulthood.
sialidosis.notes: A lysosomal storage disorder affecting multiple systems; management is supportive.

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.description: Recurrent seizures that are difficult to control.

symptoms.name: Vision Loss
symptoms.description: Progressive loss of vision over time.

symptoms.name: Cognitive Decline
symptoms.description: Deterioration in intellectual function and motor skills.

neuronal_ceroid_lipofuscinosis.notes: A group of inherited neurodegenerative disorders; treatment is supportive.

symptoms.name: Retinal Vascular Anomalies
symptoms.description: Abnormal blood vessel development in the retina.

symptoms.name: Vision Impairment
symptoms.description: Reduced visual acuity and peripheral vision loss.

familial_exudative_vitreoretinopathy.onset: Usually congenital, with progressive visual impairment during childhood.
familial_exudative_vitreoretinopathy.notes: A hereditary disorder affecting retinal vascular development; management is mainly ophthalmologic.

symptoms.name: Neovascularization
symptoms.description: Abnormal blood vessel growth in the retina.

symptoms.name: Central Vision Loss
symptoms.description: Progressive loss of central vision.

retinitis_angiomatous_proliferation.notes: A variant of age-related macular degeneration; treatment may include anti-VEGF injections.

symptoms.name: Progressive Central Vision Loss
symptoms.description: Gradual loss of central vision over time.

symptoms.name: Color Vision Deficits
symptoms.description: Difficulty distinguishing colors, particularly in the central field.

central_areolar_choroidal_dystrophy.onset: Usually begins in adulthood with slow progression.
central_areolar_choroidal_dystrophy.notes: A rare hereditary retinal dystrophy affecting the macula; currently no definitive treatment.

symptoms.name: Complete Color Blindness
symptoms.description: Inability to perceive color; only shades of gray.

symptoms.name: Photophobia
symptoms.description: Extreme sensitivity to bright light.

symptoms.name: Reduced Visual Acuity
symptoms.description: Blurry vision, especially in bright conditions.

achromatopsia.notes: A rare, non-progressive retinal disorder; management includes tinted lenses and visual aids.

symptoms.name: Reduced Pigmentation in the Eyes
symptoms.description: Light-colored irises and retina leading to vision issues.

symptoms.name: Nystagmus
