symptoms.description: Involuntary, repetitive eye movements.

symptoms.name: Photophobia
symptoms.description: Sensitivity to bright light.

ocular_albinism.onset: Congenital and evident from early childhood.
ocular_albinism.notes: Primarily affects the eyes while skin pigmentation remains normal; supportive management is used.

symptoms.name: Fine Tremors
symptoms.description: Mild, rhythmic shaking of the hands or fingers.

benign_muscular_tremor.onset: Often noticed in adulthood, typically without functional impairment.
benign_muscular_tremor.notes: A common and benign condition; usually does not require treatment.

symptoms.name: Elevated Blood Pressure in Clinical Settings
symptoms.description: High readings when measured by a healthcare professional, with normal readings at home.

white_coat_hypertension.onset: Observed during office visits; not present during routine daily activities.
white_coat_hypertension.notes: A phenomenon likely due to anxiety in clinical settings; generally does not require antihypertensive treatment.

symptoms.name: Normal Office Readings
symptoms.description: Blood pressure appears normal during clinical visits.

symptoms.name: Elevated Home Readings
symptoms.description: High blood pressure detected during ambulatory monitoring.

masked_hypertension.onset: Often discovered during 24-hour blood pressure monitoring.
masked_hypertension.notes: A condition where hypertension is only evident outside the clinical setting; requires lifestyle modification and possibly medication.

symptoms.name: Dizziness Upon Standing
symptoms.description: Lightheadedness or feeling faint when rising from a sitting or lying position.

symptoms.name: Fainting
symptoms.description: Loss of consciousness in severe cases.

orthostatic_hypotension.onset: Occurs immediately upon standing, with rapid improvement when lying down.
orthostatic_hypotension.notes: A drop in blood pressure upon standing; treatment involves fluid intake, compression stockings, and sometimes medications.

symptoms.name: Sudden Fainting
symptoms.description: Brief loss of consciousness triggered by pain, stress, or other stimuli.

symptoms.name: Prodromal Symptoms
symptoms.description: Lightheadedness, sweating, or nausea prior to fainting.

reflex_syncope.onset: Typically occurs abruptly during or after a trigger.
reflex_syncope.notes: A common cause of fainting that is usually benign; lifestyle modifications and avoidance of triggers are recommended.

symptoms.name: Fainting Spells
symptoms.description: Transient loss of consciousness accompanied by pallor and sweating.

symptoms.name: Prodromal Symptoms
symptoms.description: Dizziness, nausea, and blurred vision before the event.

vasovagal_syncope.onset: Often triggered by prolonged standing, emotional stress, or pain.
vasovagal_syncope.notes: The most common type of syncope; usually benign and managed with lifestyle adjustments.

symptoms.name: Syncope with Neck Movement
symptoms.description: Fainting or near-fainting episodes when pressure is applied to the neck.

symptoms.name: Dizziness
symptoms.description: Lightheadedness with head turning or shaving.

carotid_sinus_hypersensitivity.onset: Triggered by external pressure on the carotid sinus.
carotid_sinus_hypersensitivity.notes: A hypersensitive response of the carotid sinus that can lead to transient cerebral hypoperfusion; management may include avoidance of triggers and sometimes pacemaker insertion.

symptoms.name: Arm Claudication
symptoms.description: Pain and cramping in the arm with exertion.

symptoms.name: Dizziness
symptoms.description: Lightheadedness due to blood flow diversion from the brain.

subclavian_steal_syndrome.onset: Symptoms occur during physical activity of the affected arm.
subclavian_steal_syndrome.notes: A vascular phenomenon caused by stenosis of the subclavian artery; treatment may involve endovascular intervention.

symptoms.name: Hypertension
symptoms.description: High blood pressure that is difficult to control.

symptoms.name: Flank Pain
symptoms.description: Pain in the side due to reduced kidney perfusion.

renal_artery_stenosis.onset: Develops gradually over months to years.
renal_artery_stenosis.notes: A narrowing of the renal arteries that can lead to ischemic nephropathy; managed with medications, angioplasty, or surgery.

symptoms.name: Claudication
symptoms.description: Pain in the limbs during exercise due to poor circulation.

symptoms.name: Ulcerations
symptoms.description: Non-healing sores on the extremities.

thromboangiitis_obliterans.onset: Typically affects young male smokers with gradual onset.
thromboangiitis_obliterans.notes: Also known as Buerger’s disease; strongly associated with tobacco use and managed by smoking cessation.

symptoms.name: Postprandial Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Severe abdominal pain after eating.

symptoms.name: Weight Loss
symptoms.description: Fear of eating leading to significant weight loss.

chronic_mesenteric_ischemia.onset: Gradual onset in older individuals with atherosclerotic disease.
chronic_mesenteric_ischemia.notes: Due to reduced blood flow to the intestines; treatment may include surgical revascularization.

symptoms.name: Proximal Muscle Weakness
symptoms.description: Gradual weakness in the shoulder and pelvic muscles.

symptoms.name: Difficulty Climbing Stairs
symptoms.description: Impaired mobility due to muscle weakness.

limb_girdle_muscular_dystrophy.onset: Typically begins in adolescence or early adulthood.
limb_girdle_muscular_dystrophy.notes: A genetically heterogeneous group of muscular dystrophies; management is supportive.

symptoms.name: Hypotonia
symptoms.description: Low muscle tone present from birth.

symptoms.name: Delayed Motor Milestones
symptoms.description: Delayed achievement of milestones such as sitting or walking.

congenital_myopathy.onset: Present from birth with non-progressive or slowly progressive weakness.
congenital_myopathy.notes: A group of disorders affecting muscle structure; treatment is supportive with physical therapy.

symptoms.name: Recurrent Fevers
symptoms.description: Episodes of high temperature with symptom-free intervals.

symptoms.name: Arthralgia
symptoms.description: Joint pain accompanying fever episodes.

periodic_fever_syndrome.onset: Intermittent onset, often beginning in childhood.
periodic_fever_syndrome.notes: A group of autoinflammatory conditions; treatment depends on the specific syndrome.

symptoms.name: Recurrent Fevers
symptoms.description: Periodic episodes of high fever lasting several days.

symptoms.name: Abdominal Pain
symptoms.description: Severe pain during fever episodes.

symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.description: Erythematous rash during inflammatory attacks.

tumor_necrosis_factor_receptor_associate.onset: Typically begins in childhood with recurrent inflammatory episodes.
tumor_necrosis_factor_receptor_associate.notes: An autoinflammatory disorder due to mutations affecting the TNF receptor; treatment may include biologic agents.
